trans-unit.source: colspan

The permalink is an unique url for this page (Sometimes called guid or uuid). The permalink is generated automatically from insert tag pattern by default (See default page pattern in the settings). But it's also possible to enter any path manually.

There are some restrictions for valid urls (see RFC 3986)!

Allowed characters for a valid url are Alphanumeric characters as well as the special characters $-_.+!*()/

These insert tags can be used to insert page attributes into the permalink automatically:
{{alias}}
Will be replaced with the page name
{{parent}}
Will be replaced with the path from the parent page
{{language}}
Will be replaced with the root language (Only if the parent has not add the language already to avoid double language strings in the path)
{{index}}

This is a special insert tag and is used to indicate the page as an index page to be called directly by the domain name without a path (Attention: This will also deactivate the language redirection for this domain)
colspan

The permalink is an unique url for this news page (Sometimes called guid or uuid). The permalink is generated automatically from insert tag pattern by default (See default news pattern in the settings). But it's also possible to enter any path manually.

There are some restrictions for valid urls (see RFC 3986)!

Allowed characters for a valid url are Alphanumeric characters as well as the special characters $-_.+!*()/

These insert tags can be used to insert news attributes into the permalink automatically:
{{alias}}
Will be replaced with the news name
{{author}}
Will be replaced with the author of the news
{{page}}
Will be replaced with the path from the redirect page of the news archive
{{date}}
Will be replaced with the news date (uses the date format from the root page or the settings)
{{language}}
Will be replaced with the root language
colspan

The permalink is an unique url for this event (Sometimes called guid or uuid). The permalink is generated automatically from insert tag pattern by default (See default event pattern in the settings). But it's also possible to enter any path manually.

There are some restrictions for valid urls (see RFC 3986)!

Allowed characters for a valid url are Alphanumeric characters as well as the special characters $-_.+!*()/

These insert tags can be used to insert event attributes into the permalink automatically:
{{alias}}
Will be replaced with the event name
{{author}}
Will be replaced with the author of the event
{{page}}
Will be replaced with the path from the redirect page of the calendar
{{date}}
Will be replaced with the event start date (uses the date format from the root page or the settings)
{{time}}
Will be replaced with the event start time (uses the time format from the root page or the settings)
{{language}}
Will be replaced with the root language
